p: Although the two groups appear to be exhibiting similar behaviour, analysis of the movements of the 35 individual taxa used here (mostly species) provided compelling evidence that more diatom taxa exhibit niche plasticity than do dinoflagellate taxa. Figure 4 and Supplementary Fig. 2 show the movements of each taxon in the periods of cooling and warming, Table 1a indicates significant negative correlations between proportion north of isotherms and isotherm latitudes for each taxon and Supplementary Figs 4â€“42 show further details for each taxon and group.
